awd_titl_txt: Structural History of the Columbus Promontory, Western      Piedmont, Southern Appalachians:  Thrust Faulting Processes in the Middle Crust of a Paleozoic Orogen
awd_abstract_narration: The Blue Ridge-Piedmont thrust sheet of the southern                       Appalachians is a "type example" of a composite thrust sheet                    produced by several events, yet the emplacement history, and its                relationship to metamorphism and ages of plutonism are not well                 constrained.  This project will investigate a relatively well-                  exposed area- the Columbus Promontory- in order to address                      emplacement mechanics and physical conditions of fault                          development on several scales.  Field mapping, fabric data,                     radiometric age data of plutons and fault rocks, and                            geothermobarometric data will be collected and employed in an                   effort to constrain these large structures and discern their                    evolution.
